elementSpec.desc: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.
元資料からは，判読できないまたは聞き取れないなどの理由から，確信 を持って転記できない場所を示す．

attDef.desc: indicates why the material is hard to transcribe.
当該部分が，転記できない理由．
attDef.valDesc: any phrase describing the difficulty, e.g. faded, ambient noise, passing truck, ill formed, eccentric ductus.

attDef.desc: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.
転記の困難が，部分的な削除といった行為によるもので，その場所が， 特定の筆跡によるものである場合に，その筆跡を示す．
attDef.valDesc: must be one of the hand identifiers declared in the document header (see section ).

attDef.desc: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.
転記の困難が，損傷による場合，その損傷の種類を示す．

valItem.gloss: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface

remarks.p: The same element is used for all cases of uncertainty in the transcription of element content, whether for written or spoken material. For other aspects of certainty, uncertainty, and reliability of tagging and transcription, see chapter .
The damage, gap, del, unclear and supplied elements may be closely allied in use. See section for discussion of which element is appropriate for which circumstance.
